intro: Iris × atroenantha, commonly known as the black-eyed iris, is a hybrid plant resulting from the cross between Iris germanica and Iris pallida. It is characterized by its striking dark purple to black flowers with a yellow center, which give it its common name. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters and features sword-shaped, grass-like leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation. The botanical features of Iris × atroenantha make it both ornamental and relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
